page.title: 07Refuse Collection Oswestry
page.content:
{Oswestry Borough Council},who handle the refuse from Whittington,have their headquarters at{York Fields}in Oswestry.They have sixteen vehicles the biggest of which holds forty gallons of fuel.There are four big vehicles which collect rubbish from the public,two street vehicles with special brushes which have to be replaced each week and two normal street vehicles.There are also skip vehicles.Plastic bags are supplied for the rubbish and these are collected each week.When the bags of rubbish are thrown into the vehicles, the inside spins round so that the rubbish gets cut up and then compressed.This is called rotor pressing.Each big vehicle costs Â£37.000.
_
